metadata.synopsis: Eroll was already having a bad day, considering he is the poor impaled soul in the Smuggler’s Cave who’s begging you to help the guild members fighting the Stone Man’s men.  After said begging, he actually dies in front of your eyes.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1) Open debugbook2) Got to Region3) Act 34) Wyrm's Crossing5) Start6.0) oe OIStartOrinDyingAttacker to start the dialog (do the other steps below first if you want them enabled)6.1) oe OIEnableOrinDyingAttacker to enable journal as Orin6.2) oe OIMetOrinOnce to enable that you've met Orin in previous impersonation.

14.text: Ungh... Come to finish the job?
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The injured man is pinned to an upright piece of driftwood by a sword rammed through his belly.[LOGAN] Please check with Greg for V.O pose - please try to match as close as possibleNodeContext: Wincing, in serious pain

22.text: An idiot, that's who. Started a fight I couldn't bloody win.

6.text: Picked the wrong fight. Gave the bastard something to cry about though.

43.text: Argh. By the gods... it hurts. Help me, please.

40.text: No! It's too late for that... No potion or spell can fix this...
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player moves as if about to heal the dying attacker, but the attacker throws up a hand, telling them to stop.NodeContext: Wincing, in serious pain

21.speaker: Player
21.text: What do you want me to do?

50.text: Finish this. I can't stand the pain any longer.

65.text: I don't want saving... I want death.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: My 'help' tends to end with someone dead.

25.text: Can't imagine worse than this. Argh.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Spin the blade: twist and toy with it.

9.text: Stop. Stop! Please... just end this.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out towards the man, prodding his injury (unseen). The man grimaces in agony.NodeContext: In agony, as somebody pokes his wounds

15.text: Get this blade out of me... Use it... Kill me... kill me NOW.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *There's something strange about the man dying before your eyes. Though in agony, he seems to be enjoying this.*

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Why are you so eager to die? What's going on here?

0.text: If you had your guts falling out... you'd be eager too.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I'll stay with you until the end, but I won't speed your passage.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: What's the hurry? I'll enjoy watching you die slowly.

51.text: That's it... Watch the life drip drop away.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dying man grins.NodeContext: maniacal

34.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dying man transforms into Orin. Long transform.

27.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
27.context: NodeContext: 'It' is the Dark Urge player. 'Home' at this point is just the city, not yet the temple. 'Bone Lord's soot' refers to the player having killed Ketheric (his god Myrkul is the Lord of Bones)

44.text: Even with your head meat tumbled, you tickle and torture so brutishly. A blunt and tasteless slaughter.
44.context: NodeContext: Player chose to violently killl a dying man. 'Head meat tumbled' alluding to her tadpoling your brain. Orin judging your technique to be poor

54.text: Do you only kill with kindness, sibling? Is your head meat so tumbled and tormented?
54.context: NodeContext: Player chose to mercy kill the dying man. Mocking - "poor baby". 'Head meat' referring to tadpoling your brain.

32.text: Is this the blood-starved mercy you come to offer me, sibling? I have none to offer you.
32.context: NodeContext: Player refused to kill the dying man. Orin finds this pathetic, mocking the idea that they would refuse to kill her as well.

41.text: I could end it now - but I'll be patient. Father will see us together again. He will see you bleed.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Toying with the player, trying to make them uneasy, establish her power over them. 'Father' is Bhaal.

33.text: So you're the lickspittle who crushed the Bone Lord's thrall.
33.context: NodeContext: First time Orin meets player. 'Bone Lord's thrall' is Ketheric, who player previously killed. Curious.

11.text: Have you come beg-begging, sniffing for our stones? Gortash won't like that. A throat his black hand can't choke the spit from.
11.context: NodeContext: Mocking, finds your plan ridiculous but enjoys the chaos it will cause. 'Stones' are the netherstones. 'Black hand' reference to the 'Black Hand of Bane', Gortash's god.

7.text: He will try to bind your brutality, to make you spin the suffering for his noose.
7.context: NodeContext: Player chose to violently killl a dying man. 'He' refers to Gortash. Offering a 'friendly' warning that Gortash will try to turn the player's brutality to his advantage

4.text: When you find the lordling, tell him Orin is watching.
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Playful, menacing. Trying to make player uneasy - she could be hiding anywhere.

73.text: He will sniff out your mercies, drag them forth and use them to dress his atrocities.
73.context: NodeContext: Player chose to mercy kill the dying man. A 'friendly warning' that Gortash will turn the player's conscience against them.

38.text: He will not leave you bloodless for long. He will twitch you by the sinews, a puppet jerking and jabbing at his command.
38.context: NodeContext: Player refused to kill the dying man. 'He' refers to Gortash, a 'friendly warning' that Gortash will exploit the player's conscience/unwillingness to shed blood.

5.text: I see how you slip-slither closer, belly dragging in the filth. Father is laughing at you.
5.context: NodeContext: Second time Orin appeared to toy with you. She can't believe you're wasting so much time.

17.text: Do not worry, slaughter-kin. My blades are still sharp and sweet. They will greet you soon enough.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Mocking reassurance - trying to make the player uneasy.

72.text: Still rolling in the muck, I see.

28.text: Gortash knows you are coming. Knows you have the Bone Lord's stone. Do not let him hiss hot air into your worm-weakened brain.
28.context: NodeContext: Acting like she's helping you, but just trying to freak you out. 'Bone Lord's stone' is Ketheric's netherstone

46.text: Remember - his throat spits lies, but my blade carves the truth. You will read it on your skin soon enough.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: toying with the player, knows the 'truth' about them and is enjoying holding this against them

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I'll make it quick. You won't feel a thing.

3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player leans over the dying man, teasing the knife from his stomach. The dying man nods, giving the player permission.NodeContext: relieved, preparing to be put out of his misery

19.text: That's the best you can do? So weak.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player dispatches the dying man (off camera). They appear upset/ unhappy at their task. We see the dead man still for a beat. Then he turns to us. The knife in the player's hand disintegrates - one of Orin's illusions.NodeContext: suddenly maniacal and malicious - responding to being stabbed, and shrugging it off. Menace on the emphasised weak

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Slit him open. Make him suffer. Make him scream.

31.text: What are you doing? STOP... NO... ARGH!
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player grips the knife in the dying man's stomach, and twists it violently. A smile spreads across their face as the man screams...NodeContext: first phrase shocked, on the capitalised words he's in agony as somebody literally twists the knife in his wound

42.context: CinematicNodeContext: The man's screams turn to a giggle. The player steps back, confused, as the attacker grins.[LOGAN] Please record extra an amount of maniacal giggling / laughing V.O audio. NodeContext: sudden change from being in pain to giggling as if tickled

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Surrender to your urge. Slice him. Bleed him. Eviscerate him.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Resist the urge rising within you. Let nature take its course.

16.text: You used to take such pleasure in massacring the vulnerable.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: No. I won't have your blood on my hands.

71.text: I serve you death on a plate, and still you refuse to eat.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dying man relaxes, his agonies apparently forgotten.NodeContext: goading

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Accusing innocent passers-by is an interesting survival strategy.

69.text: No one's innocent round here. Maybe you're better than most.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: How dare you - I'd never associate with such amateur work.
